newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria gives go-ahead for first free zone.
newsitem.headline: Algeria gives go-ahead for first free zone.

text.p: Algeria's government on Wednesday granted permission for setting up the country's first free zone to attract foreign investors and speed up opening the economy, the official Algerian news agency APS reported.
The first zone is to be opened in the eastern port town of Bellara, 240 km (150 miles) from Algiers, where the governmement had planned to set up a huge steel complex.
Prime Minister Ahmed Ouyahia told a cabinet meeting on Wednesday that such zones would boost economic growth and trade. APS did not say when the free zone would become operative.
